articles.headline: Robinhood Has Lured Young Traders, Sometimes With Devastating Results
articles.snippet: Its users buy and sell the riskiest financial products and do so more frequently than customers at other retail brokerage firms, but their inexperience can lead to staggering losses.
articles.abstract: Its users buy and sell the riskiest financial products and do so more frequently than customers at other retail brokerage firms, but their inexperience can lead to staggering losses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Richard Dobatse, a Navy medic in San Diego, dabbled infrequently in stock trading. But his behavior changed in 2017 when he signed up for Robinhood, a trading app that made buying and selling stocks simple and seemingly free.

articles.headline: United Airlines Could Furlough 36,000 Workers as Virus Cases Soar
articles.snippet: The airline warned workers that they could lose their jobs because demand for travel remains weak and appears to be falling again as infections rise.
articles.abstract: The airline warned workers that they could lose their jobs because demand for travel remains weak and appears to be falling again as infections rise.
articles.lead_paragraph: United Airlines said on Wednesday that it could furlough as many as 36,000 employees, or nearly 40 percent of its global work force, this fall if travel remained weak and more workers did not accept concessions like reduced hours or buyout and early retirement packages.

articles.headline: New Transcripts Detail Last Moments for George Floyd
articles.snippet: “They’ll kill me. They’ll kill me,” Mr. Floyd pleaded, according to a body camera transcript in court filings by a former officer who wants the charges against him dismissed.
articles.abstract: “They’ll kill me. They’ll kill me,” Mr. Floyd pleaded, according to a body camera transcript in court filings by a former officer who wants the charges against him dismissed.
articles.lead_paragraph: George Floyd’s dying moments have played on an endless loop, horrifying the world and prompting a spasm of street protests, but newly released evidence reveals an even more desperate scene than previously known in the moments before an officer pressed his knee into Mr. Floyd’s neck.
articles.byline: By Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Kim Barker

articles.headline: In ‘Buy American’ Speech, Biden Challenges Trump on the Economy
articles.snippet: Joseph R. Biden Jr. laid out a populist economic vision with the tagline “Build Back Better,” part of an effort to confront President Trump on his strongest issue in polling.
articles.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr. laid out a populist economic vision with the tagline “Build Back Better,” part of an effort to confront President Trump on his strongest issue in polling.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live coverage of the 2020 election between Joe Biden and President Trump.
articles.byline: By Shane Goldmacher and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: Joy Reid Takes Nightly Anchor Slot at MSNBC
articles.snippet: She becomes one of the few Black women to anchor a major American evening news program. The move was made by new leadership at NBC News, which runs the liberal-leaning cable network.
articles.abstract: She becomes one of the few Black women to anchor a major American evening news program. The move was made by new leadership at NBC News, which runs the liberal-leaning cable network.
articles.lead_paragraph: Joy Reid, who rose to television fame as a sharp critic of President Trump and commentator on liberal politics and race, will become the host of a new nightly show on MSNBC, the network announced on Thursday, placing her among a handful of Black women to anchor an American evening news program.

articles.headline: Landmark Supreme Court Ruling Affirms Native American Rights in Oklahoma
articles.snippet: A 5-4 decision declaring that much of eastern Oklahoma is an Indian reservation could reshape criminal justice in the area by preventing state authorities from prosecuting Native Americans.
articles.abstract: A 5-4 decision declaring that much of eastern Oklahoma is an Indian reservation could reshape criminal justice in the area by preventing state authorities from prosecuting Native Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Thursday ruled that much of eastern Oklahoma falls within an Indian reservation, a decision that could reshape the criminal justice system by preventing state authorities from prosecuting offenses there that involve Native Americans.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy and Adam Liptak

articles.headline: Supreme Court Rules Trump Cannot Block Release of Financial Records
articles.snippet: Two rulings clear the way for prosecutors in New York to seek President Trump’s financial records, but the justices stopped Congress for now.
articles.abstract: Two rulings clear the way for prosecutors in New York to seek President Trump’s financial records, but the justices stopped Congress for now.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court cleared the way on Thursday for prosecutors in New York to seek President Trump’s financial records in a stunning defeat for Mr. Trump and a major statement on the scope and limits of presidential power.

articles.headline: ‘Big Mess’ Looms if Schools Don’t Get Billions to Reopen Safely
articles.snippet: As President Trump and others push to get students back in the classroom this fall, educators say they need more support and clearer guidelines.
articles.abstract: As President Trump and others push to get students back in the classroom this fall, educators say they need more support and clearer guidelines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bus monitors to screen students for symptoms in Marietta, Ga.: $640,000. Protective gear and classroom cleaning equipment for a small district in rural Michigan: $100,000. Disinfecting school buildings and hiring extra nurses and educators in San Diego: $90 million.
